reviews.review: Action packed and an excellent end to the Saga.  It's 10x better than Last Jedi and gives fans what they want in a Star Wars movie.  Some surprising cameos along the way as well.  A must see for true Star Wars fans!

Exceptional ending to my child hood saga. Chills during several scenes of the movie. 
Absolutely loved it.
Fitting closure for the saga that certainly reflects Joseph Campbell's power of myth. Now let new adventures begin.
It was kinda slow and for me a little boring
this was so disappointing!  I can hardly stay for the full movie!

(Spoilers) Overall, I enjoyed The Rise of Skywalker, but I felt some things didn't sit well with me. I didn't like the rushed pace of the movie. It seemed too much in a hurry to get to the next battle or confrontation. The action scenes were well done however. I also didn't like the misuse of the character Rose Tico. TLJ established her as an important character and TROS kept her completely in the background with little dialogue. I thought there would have been a romance between her and Finn. Rose could have filled the role that Jannah provided. Last thing I disliked was that the ending felt messy. The things that worked for me was the conflict within Rey, who prior to this point in the trilogy, seemed invincible. The banter between Finn and Poe was cool. The Ben Solo/ Kylo Ren journey was well done. The Emperor as always was well acted and served as a great villain. Two things I was meh on was the C3PO mind wipe scene, it had little impact because he got his memory back. Also the Rey/Ben kiss scene felt forced, they didn't really have any dialogue or scene in the trilogy to make that a good payoff. Overall I think that not everyone will enjoy the movie because of internet opinion and the fact that Star Wars has always been a series that changes people's opinions over multiple viewings and over the test of time.
Same story over and over. Terrible lines, terrible acting. Pretty sure this movie was made to be played at 1.2-1.4 speed.
GOOD ENDING TO A CRAPPY TRiLOGY!
The conclusion of Star Wars was fast-paced, captivating, and rewarding. Never mind pretentious critics, this movie was well-worth the watch.
